description: Get the current configuration values for model invocation logging.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Knowing the logging setup allows attackers to delete or alter logs to avoid detection and cover their tracks.
Attackers may use knowledge of logging configurations to craft their actions in ways that avoid triggering specific logging mechanisms.
Understanding how model invocation is logged can reveal what security software is in use.
Knowing the logging configuration can help attackers understand how to disable or evade defensive logging.
Attackers might tailor their command and control communication methods based on the logging configurations discovered.

If the option textDataDeliveryEnabled is activated there could be credentials in it which attackers can exploit. If the option imageDataDeliveryEnabled is activated there could be sensitive information in the images which are delivered in the logs.

securityImplications: Attackers might use GetModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration to check S3 and Cloudwatch logging configuration.
